DataElement.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Negation Begin Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An explanation for why the activity that produces an effect, or intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population, did not begin.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Making more complex or intricate.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Making more complex or intricate.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

Concepts.definition: The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a disease over time

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM definitions to reflect change in NCIt concept definition. mc 10/31/13

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.: Satisfying the appropriate conditions for inclusion.: Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.

Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.
Satisfying the appropriate conditions for inclusion.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Treatment used instead of, or supplementary to, conventional Western-based practices. Alternative medicine includes treatments and practices such as acupuncture, holistic medicine, homeopathy, ayurveda, Chinese medicine, massage therapy, herbal therapy, and biofeedback.

Concepts.definition: Treatment used instead of, or supplementary to, conventional Western-based practices. Alternative medicine includes treatments and practices such as acupuncture, holistic medicine, homeopathy, ayurveda, Chinese medicine, massage therapy, herbal therapy, and biofeedback.
The cessation of life.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly._A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something._Where something is available or from where it originates.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
Where something is available or from where it originates.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.: A discrepancy between a computed, observed, or measured value or condition and the true, specified, or theoretically correct value or condition.

Concepts.definition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.
A discrepancy between a computed, observed, or measured value or condition and the true, specified, or theoretically correct value or condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A treatment is suspended._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: A treatment is suspended.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future)._Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).
Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
